item.title: Favorite R Packages
item.description: Sourcing readxl - importing Excel files including individual worksheets rio - simplify importing and exporting data across source formats datapasta - copy/paste data using clipboard rvest - A set of useful tools for working with http connections Wrangling dplyr - transform and summarize data frames stringr - manipulate regular expressions and character strings lubridate - simplify working with dates and times glue - concatentate strings and/or data tidyr - change the layout of data sets magrittr - set of operators to make code more readable such as the pipe purrr - functional programming to automate iterations janitor - simple functions for cleaning dirty data tidytext - simplify text mining Modeling broom - converts statistical model output to tidy data Exploring DataExplorer - automated scanning and visualizing of each data set field Visualizing ggplot2 - R’s famous package for beautiful graphics usibg the grammar of graphics ggmap - access Google API to download Google maps and geolocations scales - maps data to aesthetics, automatically determines breaks and labels for axes and legends.

item.title: Visualizations
item.description: A collection of data visualizations I have built for fun using the R programming language. All visualizations are produced via code without post-processing. The examples source data from the weekly R4DS #TidyTuesday project, which is a community for R and tidyverse enthusisasts to practice and share ideas in wrangling, exploring and visualizing data.
